meanings.definition: The middle of a term or period of time, especially in a school semester.
meanings.sent1: During the midterm, students review what they've learned so far.
meanings.sent2: The midterm break is a good time to relax and recharge.
meanings.sent3: The midterm seemed to sneak up on the students, surprising them.
meanings.sent4: In the hectic school year, the midterm is like a calm oasis in the middle.
meanings.sent5: The midterm is like a checkpoint, marking progress in the semester.

meanings.definition: An examination or test given in the middle of a term or period of time.
meanings.sent1: Studying for the midterm can help improve your grades.
meanings.sent2: The midterm results will show how well you understand the material.
meanings.sent3: The students joked that the midterm was their 'halfway to stress' moment.
meanings.sent4: Facing the midterm is like climbing a challenging mountain in the semester.
meanings.sent5: The midterm is a chance to shine and demonstrate your knowledge.
